item.title: How to Add an Alias in Macos Terminal
item.description: Zsh is the default MacOS Shell. So to add an alias, we need to make changes to the zsh config file that is .zshrc. Open .zshrc.zshrc is typically present in the home folder ~/.zshrc Adding aliasAdd the alias to the .zshrc in the following syntax alias aliasName="command" Source .zshrcAfter saving, source .zshrc using the following command in the Terminal $ source ~/.zshrc
